name: HassanMunene
quote: Today I discovered this amazing open source tool call HTTP Toolkit that you can use to intercept HTTP and HTTPS traffic for analysing and debugging. In case you want to look at header and body of your HTTP messages then this tool is really amazing.

name: Darasus
quote: Pro tip: If you want to debug @trpcio remote procedure calls in @reactjs server components, @HttpToolkit is your best friend

name: Toni Castillo
quote: Acabo de descubrir HTTP Toolkit y me flipa: https://httptoolkit.tech. Una herramienta para interceptar, depurar, testear y simular con HTTP. Y adem√°s es de c√≥digo abierto.

name: Yi Ding
quote: Totally unpaid product endorsement: really really like @HttpToolkit for debugging LLM requests/responses. One click copy-paste into your terminal and all requests/responses including SSL are automatically proxied and viewable.

name: Stavros
quote:
I love @pimterry's @HttpToolkit so damn much, it's the only thing that let me intercept Android apps' requests, and did it with just two clicks.

I'm just stunned, fantastic work.

name: Petr Stribny
quote: Great tool for debugging and mocking HTTP requests https://httptoolkit.tech #debugging #softwaredevelopment

name: zaheckmania
quote: When it comes to flutter app penetration testing it's a nightmare for me. But today I found an awesome tool #HttpToolkit which helps to inspect flutter app traffic with a seamless connection. Thank you @HttpToolkit

name: Noob
quote: @pimterry knows what he is doing. Great code in HTTP toolkit.

name: Guy Gascoigne-Piggford
quote: If you ever want to easily look at what api calls your non-browser process is making, then https://httptoolkit.tech is really effective and trivial to setup.  Saved me a lot of time, a very neat tool.

name: Cuckoo Chickoo
quote: @HttpToolkit is the first thing I install before even starting to work on any project

name: Faisal Rathore
quote: what an awesome tool!!

name: Elijah Lynn
quote:
@httptoolkit is one of the most useful debugging tools EVER! You can intercept all HTTPS requests AND responses and MOCK responses! So FUDGING valuable!

So excited to see this tool develop and just submitted a software request to my company!

name: Adam Williams
quote: Working with @erkang to get past an unexpected API response uploading #jupiterone security policies to #confluence for our customers. Bumped into https://httptoolkit.tech amazed how it just worked to trace HTTP from any Terminal.app sub-process!

name: Johannes Wuensch
quote: Just tested it. Works like a charm! Thank you so much!

name: jahz_v
quote: Man I have no idea how I built web apps before @HttpToolkit. If you haven't gotten it yet get it now! Being able to intercept ALL outgoing requests (including pre-flight OPTIONS for CORS reqs!!) is v v handy

name: Vikas
quote: @HttpToolkit is a must-have for developers and security enthusiasts! üåêüîí With its user-friendly interface, it lets you intercept, inspect, and manipulate HTTP(S) traffic effortlessly.

name: Neil Craig
quote: OK, confirmed by @HttpToolkit (which is ace BTW!), Chrome (stable) is not making HTTP requests to my endpoint...

name: wget
quote: Wow. I switched from AdvancedRestCient and mitmproxy to @HttpToolkit and my life has just changed. I'm noticing additional traffic from my printer I didn't notice with mitmproxy. The configuration is also much more easier to achieve. I've never been a fan of Postman or Insomnia.

name: Sam Yates
quote: I'm always impressed at the thought that went into it when I fire up @HttpToolkit

name: ·¥Ä…¥·¥õ ú·¥è…¥ è  ú…™·¥†·¥á Ä·¥õ
quote:
I just tried @HttpToolkit after used charles.
Wow! Less than 5 minutes to make my Ubuntu intercept https traffic from my smartphone. Fast and simple!

And it's open source ! ü§©

#api #android #opensource #https

name: Emma Heffernan
quote: Stumbled upon a nice find - it's an open source alternative software to the likes of Burp Suite etc. Very handy and neatly done, have a look: https://httptoolkit.tech

name: Tiago Almeida
quote: Tried out @HttpToolkit to custom map some requests on Android. Very impressed with it, good UI and the automatic certificate setup with emulator is great

name: Rafael Gonzaga
quote: Excellent open-source HTTP debugging! https://httptoolkit.tech

name: Nik Molnar
quote: I like @HttpToolkit's integration with @OpenApiSpec! Nifty little feature that overlays OpenAPI documentation over a Postman like experience.

name: Heikki Tolvanen
quote: Thank you for your quick response! I really like your tool and will recommend it to anyone inspecting the privacy issues of websites :)

name: Catalin Ghita
quote: I use HTTP Toolkit, it's really nice.

name: @fergal@anyska.fergl.ie
quote: Oh that's really nice, love how you can intercept an individual browser window. So long mitmproxy!

name: Vijendra Chouhan
quote: Recently I came across this amazing tool named HTTPtoolkit for reverse engineering one of my Android App. This tool helps you to intercept and view all your https by connecting with ADB and by providing a user friendly GUI.

name: vlad.near
quote: Wow https://httptoolkit.tech is one of the best development tools I've seen in a while.

name: Jan
quote: If you need to inspect HTTP traffic from (say) Node.js app, try @HttpToolkit. No need to mess with proxy settings or self-signed certificates, just start a "Fresh Terminal" and start your app. Works like a charm

name: Marco
quote:
You made my day with https://httptoolkit.tech
Amazing

name: Esa Firman
quote: HTTP Toolkit's Github is so delightful, it explain each of the component clearly and they open source all of the codes. Can't wait to test it!

name: vishnu
quote: Must have tool for android pentest!!
